column2: NEW JERSEY DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 2. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 3. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 5. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 6. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 7. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 8. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 9. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column8: go the wrong way.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycle parking ahead
column10: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 11. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column10: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.

column2: 12. If a collision is possible, you should:
column4: choose to hit something that will give way rather than something rigid.
column6: if you have to hit anything, try to make it a sideswipe.
column8: choose to hit something that is standing still rather than something moving toward you.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: No U-Turn

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column8: a side road.

column2: 16. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column10: the entrance to a construction site.

column2: 18. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 19. These are:
column8: regulatory signs.

column2: 20. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column6: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column8: Roundabout ahead.

column2: 22. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column8: directly behind them.

column2: 23. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 24. Aggressive drivers:
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 25. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column8: No right turn.
column10: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.

column2: 26. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 27. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column8: Drivers who are fatigued.

column2: 28. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 29. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 30. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column8: orange

column2: 31. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column8: Crossroad

column2: 33. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 34. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 35. Alcohol causes:
column8: loss of concentration.

column2: 36. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column8: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 37. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 38. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
39. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 40. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 41. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column8: no U-turn

column2: 42. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column8: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: Merging traffic

column2: 44. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 45. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 46. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 47. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column8: Highway entrance ramp ahead

column2: 49. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column6: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: in school zones.

column2: 50. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column8: maintain
